case_vignette: A 57-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-week history of abdominal bloating and increased frequency of stools! He describes the stools as bulky, foul-smelling, and difficult to flush! He also has a 4-month history of recurrent dull upper abdominal pain that usually lasts for a few days, worsens after meals, and is not relieved with antacids! He has had a 10-kg (22-lb) weight loss in the past 4 months! He has no personal or family history of serious illness! He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for 37 years! He has a 12-year history of drinking 6 to 8 beers daily! He is 160 cm (5 ft 3 in) tall and weighs 52 kg (115 lb); BMI is 20 kg/m2! His vital signs are within normal limits! Abdominal examination shows mild epigastric tenderness without rebound or guarding! Bowel sounds are normal! The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities!
question: Which  is the most appropriate next step in diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've been experiencing abdominal bloating, an increased frequency of bulky, foul-smelling stools that are difficult to flush, and recurrent dull upper abdominal pain that worsens after meals. I also have had significant weight loss recently.
Have you been diagnosed with any health conditions in the past or are currently on any medication?
No, I have no personal or family history of serious illness and I'm not currently on any medication.
Are you experiencing any other symptoms like skin rash, anemia, or fatigue?
No, I am not experiencing any of those symptoms.
Have you recently traveled abroad or changed your usual diet?
No, I have not recently traveled abroad or changed my usual diet.
Do you consume a lot of dairy products, and have these symptoms worsened after consuming such products?
No, my symptoms do not worsen after consuming dairy products.
Final Diagnosis: Celiac disease

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've been experiencing abdominal bloating, an increased frequency of bulky, foul-smelling stools that are difficult to flush, recurrent dull upper abdominal pain that worsens after meals, and I've also lost a significant amount of weight recently.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've had abdominal bloating and changes in my stools for about 3 weeks, and the dull upper abdominal pain and weight loss have been occurring for the past 4 months.
Do you have any pre-existing medical conditions or have you been diagnosed with any illnesses in the past?
No, I don’t have any personal or family history of serious illness.
Are you currently taking any medication or supplements?
No, I'm not taking any medications or supplements.

The pain usually worsens after meals, but I haven't specifically noticed if it's related to gluten or dairy.

No, I haven't noticed any changes in the color of my stool, just that they are bulky and foul-smelling.
Final Diagnosis: Exocrine Pancreatic Insufficiency
